Sign in to view what\'s new!
This is your personal dashboard for the Talent Exchange. It\'s your portal to finding anything you need for your next freelance gig with PwC.
Before We start matching you to jobs, you\'ll need to complete your profile.

Start date: August 10, 2015
End date: September 23, 2015
Duration: 6 weeks, onsite full time
Worksite: Bethesda, MD

This project seeks an experienced anti-money laundering analyst with previous work history in government, international business, and commerce. It is a six week engagement on-site in Bethesda. This analyst will pair with a team of six other analysts to work in coordination.Additional details include work history in government, international business, and commerce. It is a six week engagement on-site in Bethesda. This analyst will pair with a team of six other analysts to work in coordination.

To complete this step, just upload a file or copy and paste the content.
Please complete this questionnaire. It will help our Service Provider, MBO Partners, determine your tax classification and work arrangement. They will then reach out directly to confirm the results.

Be on the lookout for an email from Sterling Infosystems,PwC’s screening vendor, with instructions to complete a background check. You are responsible for completing this in a timely fashion. Background check results are valid for one year.
You will receive a request via email to complete your compliance confirmation. This form must be completed on a per project basis and will not take longer than 30 minutes to complete.

You will receive two emails from the Ethics and Compliance Office. The first includes the link for the training, and the second includes your username and password to access the training. The training must be completed within 30 days of startingwork. Once completed, this training is valid for one year.

"Thank you for electing to complete PwC's Talent Exchange pre-check process! While undergoing pre-checking does not guarantee you a role, it may put you in a preferential position when being considered for one, particularly for roles that have an urgent start date."

"You will soon receive an email from Sterling Infosystems, PwC's screening vendor, with instructions for completing a background check. You must complete the screening before you can start work on a Talent Exchange role. Background checks are valid for one year."
Begin by clicking here to complete a brief
to help us better align you with roles that fit your preferences.
Your background check is complete! It will expire on
Your Ethics and Compliance training is complete.Congratulations, you\'ll never have to review it!
Independence and Compliance is a simple form that takes less than 10 minutes.Similar to the background check,it expires in a year so be sure to check back and make sure you\'re up to date !
Here\'s what we found in your LinkedIn profile. Import it now and get your Talent Exchange profile off to a great start.
Importing your profile info helps us find you the best PwC roles. If you choose not to import now,you can always import later from your profile page.

Financial Intelligence Unit responsible for special look back project on identified foreign Moneygram agents and customers for a twelve month period as well as ongoing international suspicious activity referred from the regional offices during the company\'s transition to a different AML.
sign up successful ! We have sent a validation email to your email address!Please check your email and validate from there within 24 hours.

You password must be between 8 and 16 characters in length.
Your password should contain at least one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, one numeric digit or one special character.
Start date must be in the past.
End date must be in the past.
Date must be in the past.
End date should be after start date.

This six week on-site engagement in Bethesda seeks an experienced anti-money laundering analyst with previous work history in government, international business, and commerce.
This is the current range of rates other Talent Exchange contractors have offered:
Set your rate for this role. This is the rate you will be paid if you are selected.
Please note: you may enter a lower rate later if you wish,but you may not raise your rate during the pricing event.

Provide a bit of context on why you feel you \'re the right fit for this role. You can update it at any time during the pricing event so take your time and let us know why you fit with the PwC family.

Once the pricing event has begun, you will submit a rate. You can update your rate as many times as you would like during the pricing event as long as you always update with a lower rate. You will be held to this rate should you be selected by the hiring manager.
You will be held to your final rate should you be selected by an engagement manager.

Deleting your account will erase all data, including your profile information, preferences and saved roles. You will need to register again and set up a new profile if you choose to come back.

PwC is committed to protecting your personal information. This statement explains how we treat information that we collect about you as an individual through Talent Exchange. By using Talent Exchange, you agree to the terms of this statement. This privacy statement may be amended from time to time. Any substantial changes will be communicated to users.\n\n\'PwC\', \'we\' and \'us\' refer to PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC US), the US member firm of the PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) global network of member firms. Each PricewaterhouseCoopers member firm is a separate legal entity. For further details, please see www.pwc.com/structure.

As part of the user registration process for Talent Exchange, we collect personal information about you, including your name, telephone number(s), and email address(es).

You can also complete your profile on Talent Exchange with a range of additional types of information about yourself, including your education and professional credentials, your experience and technical skills, your desired types of project work, and your geographical location preferences. PwC may collect this information directly from you through Talent Exchange or through other sources, including email and telephone. It is up to you how much of this additional information you want to provide to PwC. Lastly, you can update these preferences anytime under their Account settings/Communication Settings within the application.

If you provide sensitive personal information to PwC through Talent Exchange or other sources, you do so voluntarily and PwC accepts your consent for us to collect, store and use your sensitive personal information in the same ways as other personal information described in this statement.

If you believe Talent Exchange has collected excessive information, we encourage you to contact us at TalentExchange@us.pwc.com to raise any concerns.
The primary purposes for which PwC collects your information on Talent Exchange and for which PwC may use it are:

Cookies may be used on some pages of Talent Exchange. "Cookies" are small text files placed on your hard drive that assist us in providing a more customized website experience. For example, a cookie can be used to store registration information so that you do not need to re-enter it on subsequent visits to the site. It is PwC's policy to use cookies to make navigation of our websites easier for visitors and to facilitate efficient registration procedures. Site statistics are compiled by third parties and therefore your IP address will be passed to third parties for statistical reporting only.

If you are concerned about cookies, most browsers permit individuals to decline cookies. In most cases a visitor may refuse a cookie and still fully navigate our website, however, other functionality in the site may be impaired. After termination of the visit to our site, you can always delete the cookie from your system if you wish.

In order to properly manage our website, we may anonymously log information on our operational systems, and identify categories of visitors by items, such as domains and browser types. These statistics are reported in the aggregate to our webmasters. This is to ensure that our website presents the best web experience for visitors and is an effective information resource.

Further information about cookies used on Talent Exchange is available http://www.pwc.com/us/en/site-information.html

Personal information collected by PwC may be transferred or disclosed to third party contractors, subcontractors, subsidiaries and/or other PwC firms for the purposes for which you have submitted the information and for the administration of our site and/or other internal, administrative purposes. Personal information may also be transferred to third party service providers of identity management, website hosting and management, data analysis, data back-up, security and storage services. As a result, your personal information may also be transferred outside the country where you are located. By submitting personal information through this site, you are providing explicit consent to the transfer of such information for the fulfilment of your voluntary requests or otherwise as set out in the 'Use of personal information' section.

It's PwC's policy to disclose information to third parties under the following circumstances:
• As required by applicable law, statue, rule, regulation or professional standard, or through subpoena, search warrant or other legal process.
• For regulatory compliance purposes.
• When explicitly requested by a user.
• Or otherwise as set out in this statement.

PwC is committed to providing reasonable practical access to users to allow them the opportunity to identify and correct the accuracy of identifying information previously submitted to PwC. When personal information is retained, PwC assumes responsibility for keeping an accurate record of the information once a user has submitted and verified the data. PwC does not assume responsibility for verifying the ongoing accuracy of the content of personal information. When practically possible, if PwC is informed that any personal information collected through Talent Exchange is no longer accurate, PwC will make appropriate corrections based on the updated information that you provide.

If you would like to exercise your rights under applicable law to obtain details of personal information PwC holds about you, or to correct that information, please contact us at TalentExchange@us.pwc.com. You can also contact us at TalentExchange@us.pwc.com if you have a complaint about PwC's handling of your personal information.

You may deactivate your account at any time by making a request to TalentExchange@us.pwc.com.
PwC will retain your personal information for as long as is required for any of the purposes described above, or longer if required by applicable law or regulation.

PwC understands the importance of protecting children\'s privacy especially in an online environment. This site is not intentionally designed for or directed at children under the age of 13 years. It is PwC\'s policy never to knowingly collect or maintain personally identifiable information about children under the age of 13.

PwC has put in place appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal information from loss, misuse or destruction, including unauthorized, accidental or unlawful disclosure or processing of your personal information. Only authorized personnel are provided access to personal information and these employees have agreed to maintain the confidentiality of this information.
PwC may update this statement at any time by publishing an updated version here. You can access the most current version of this privacy statement at any time on this site.

CHANGE AND ACCESS TO TALENT EXCHANGE

Welcome to PwC\'s Talent Exchange (the \"Exchange\"). Talent Exchange is provided by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (\"PwC,\" \"we\" or \"us\"), the US member firm of the PricewaterhouseCoopers network of firms, each of which is a separate legal entity. Please see www.pwc.com/structure for further details. If you do not agree to these Terms and Conditions, please do not use the PwC Talent Exchange and exit now.\n\nWe may revise these Terms of Use at any time without prior notice by updating this page and such revisions will be effective upon posting to this page. Please check this page periodically for any changes. If PwC makes substantial material changes to the Terms and Conditions, we will ask that you acknowledge and accept the new terms and conditions in order to continue using Talent Exchange. Your continued use of Talent Exchange following the posting of any revisions to these Terms of Use will mean you accept those changes. We reserve the right to alter, suspend or discontinue any aspect of Talent Exchange, including your access to it. Unless explicitly stated, any new features will be subject to these Terms of Use.

Talent Exchange is not intended for use by children under the age of 18. You must be at least 18 years old and have reached the age of majority in your jurisdiction of primary residence and citizenship to participate in Talent Exchange.

You may not access or use Talent Exchange if you are a citizen or national of any country that is subject to U.S. export restrictions (currently including, but not necessarily limited to, Iran, Syria, Cuba, North Korea, Libya, and Sudan). Also, you may not access or use Talent Exchange from any such country. You may not use Talent Exchange if you do not have legal authorization to work in the United States. If any applicable law, rule or regulation prohibits your access of Talent Exchange, you may not access or use Talent Exchange.

If you have any questions regarding these Terms of Use, contact us at TalentExchange@us.pwc.com.

Talent Exchange may contain profiles, email systems, blogs, message boards, applications, job postings, chat areas, groups, forums, independent talent communities and/or other message or communication facilities ("Public Areas") that allow users to communicate with other users. You may only use such community areas to send and receive messages and material that are relevant and proper to the applicable purposes.

Without limitation, while using the Service, you may not:
• Defame, abuse, harass, stalk, threaten or otherwise violate the legal rights (such as, but not limited to, rights of privacy and publicity) of others, including PwC staff.
• Publish, post, upload, distribute or disseminate any profane, defamatory, infringing, obscene or unlawful topic, name, material or information.
• Use Talent Exchange for any wrongful purpose, including, but not limited to violation of local, state, national, or international law.
• Upload files that contain software or other material that violates the intellectual property rights (or rights of privacy or publicity) of any third party.
• Upload files that contain viruses, Trojan horses, corrupted files, or any other similar software that may damage or interfere with the operation of another's computer.
• Post or upload any content to which you have not obtained any necessary rights or permissions to use accordingly.
• Advertise or offer to sell any goods or services for any commercial purpose through Talent Exchange which are not relevant to the services offered through Talent Exchange.
• Impersonate another person or a User or allow any other person or entity to use your identification to post or view comments.
• Participate in matching events in a manner that could be interpreted as "spamming" to PwC. Spamming is strictly prohibited.
• Download any file posted by another User that a User knows, or reasonably should know, cannot be legally distributed through the Service.
• Restrict or inhibit any other User from using and enjoying the Public Areas of Talent Exchange.
• Imply or state that any statements you make are endorsed by PwC, without the prior written consent of PwC.
• Use a robot, spider, manual and/or automatic processes or devices to data-mine, data-crawl, scrape or index the Service in any manner.
• Hack or interfere with the Service, its servers or any connected networks.
• Adapt, alter, license, sublicense or translate Talent Exchange for your own personal or commercial use.
• Remove or alter, visually or otherwise, any copyrights, trademarks or proprietary marks and rights owned by PwC.
• Upload content that is offensive and/or harmful, including, but not limited to, content that advocates, endorses, condones or promotes racism, bigotry, hatred or physical harm of any kind against any individual or group of individuals.
• Upload content that provides materials or access to materials that exploit people under the age of 18 in an abusive, violent or sexual manner.
• Use Talent Exchange to solicit for any other business, website or service, or otherwise contact Users for employment, contracting or any purpose not related to use of Talent Exchange as set forth herein.
• Use Talent Exchange to collect usernames and email addresses of Users by electronic or other means.
• Register under different usernames or identities, after your account has been suspended or terminated.

You understand that all submissions made to Public Areas will be visible to all other Talent Exchange members and that you will be publicly identified by your name or login identification when communicating in Public Areas, and PwC will not be responsible for the action of any Users with respect to any information or materials posted in Public Areas.

You may only use Talent Exchange if you are at least 18 years of age. In order to access certain features of Talent Exchange, including, without limitation, the price setting event functions, profile editing, and viewing opportunities.

You may not access or use Talent Exchange if you are a citizen or national of any country that is subject to U.S. export restrictions (currently including, but not necessarily limited to, Iran, Syria, Cuba, North Korea, Libya, and Sudan). Also, you may not access or use Talent Exchange from any such country. You may not use Talent Exchange if you do not have legal authorization to work in the United States. If any applicable law, rule or regulation prohibits your access of Talent Exchange, you may not access or use Talent Exchange.

If you do not qualify under the foregoing eligibility requirements, you cannot use Talent Exchange. In the event that you are a person who does not meet the eligibility criteria set out above but nevertheless registers and uses Talent Exchange, as a non-eligible party you will still be bound to all the terms and conditions of this Agreement and shall have all the obligations, responsibilities and liabilities as would an eligible entity or person that is a party to this Agreement. PwC reserves the right to remove any user at any time at own discretion.

You will need to set up an account in order to use some of the features of Talent Exchange. You may not use a third party\'s account without PwC\'s permission. When you are setting up your account, you must give accurate and complete information. This means that you cannot set up an account using a name or contact information that does not apply to you, and you must provide accurate and current information on all registration forms that are part of Talent Exchange and update us promptly after any information you have previously provided changes. You may only set up one account. You have complete responsibility for your account and everything that happens on your account. This means you need to be careful with your password. If you find out that someone is using your account without your permission, you must let us know immediately. If you become aware of a breach of security with respect to your username or password, you must immediately notify PwC Talent Exchange team by emailing TalentExchange@us.pwc.com.\n\nYou may not transfer your account to someone else. We are not liable for any damages or losses caused by someone using your account without your permission or by your failure to provide and maintain accurate and current information. However, if we (or anyone else) suffer any damage due to the unauthorized use of your account, or because of your failure to provide and maintain accurate information, you may be liable. PwC reserves the right, acting in its sole discretion, to accept, reject or cancel registrations for this Talent Exchange. PwC may revoke your Registered User status at any time.

You understand and agree that no representation or warranty is made with respect to the functionality or availability of Talent Exchange, and that all or any portion(s) of Talent Exchange may for a variety of reasons be unavailable to you for use either temporarily or permanently without notice. PwC reserves the right in its sole discretion, without notice, to suspend your access to parts of Talent Exchange or to change the content, presentation, performance, or functionality of Talent Exchange. PwC reserves the right to monitor, edit and remove any content available on Talent Exchange, but does not have the obligation to do so.\n\nTalent Exchange is provided \"as is,\" without any warranty, and your use of Talent Exchange is at your own risk. You agree that PwC, its licensors and suppliers will not have any liability due to your inability to access Talent Exchange, any portion thereof or any related data or information, and will not have any liability in connection with the loss or destruction of any such data or information.

PwC will award the work at its sole discretion. Although cost will be considered in selecting who we award the work to, it is only one factor in our decision making, and we reserve the right to select or reject any submission in our sole discretion. The person who is awarded the work will be notified via Talent Exchange and must then complete PwC\'s independent talent onboarding process, including worker classification, compliance, and background checks. In the event of problems with that process, PwC reserves the right to revoke the award and select a different participant or service provider. Anyone not awarded the work will be notified via email.

Except as otherwise indicated, Talent Exchange and its entire content (including, but not limited to, the text, photographs, information, graphics, images, sound, and animation) are owned by PwC or its licensors and are protected by domestic and international copyright, trademark, patent, and other intellectual property laws. All copyrightable text and graphics, the selection, arrangement, and presentation of all materials (including information in the public domain), and the overall design of Talent Exchange are PwC's. All rights reserved. We hereby give you permission to download and print materials from our Talent Exchange for the sole purposes of viewing, reading, and retaining for reference the materials for your personal, internal and non-commercial use without the right for you to distribute any of the same further. Any other copying, distribution, retransmission, or modification of information or materials on Talent Exchange, whether in electronic or other form, without our express prior written permission is strictly prohibited. You further agree that you will not disassemble, decompile, reverse engineer or otherwise modify the material on Talent Exchange. Any unauthorized or prohibited use may subject the offender to civil liability and criminal prosecution under applicable laws. All trademarks, service marks, and trade names are proprietary to PwC or other respective owners that have granted us the right and license to use their marks.

You agree to take reasonable security precautions to maintain the confidentiality of Talent Exchange and all information contained in or accessed via Talent Exchange, and you may not share any of the same with any third party.

We respect the intellectual property of others, and we ask you to do the same. We may, in appropriate circumstances and at our sole discretion, terminate the access of users who infringe the copyright rights of others. If you believe that your work has been copied and is accessible at our Talent Exchange in a way that constitutes copyright infringement, or that our Talent Exchange contains links or other references to another online location that contains material or activity that infringes your copyright rights, you may notify us by providing our copyright agent the information required by the U.S. Online Copyright Infringement Liability Limitation Act of the U.S. Digital Millennium Copyright Act, 17 U.S.C. 512. If you believe that you or someone else has violated the above, please contact PwC immediately at TalentExchange@us.pwc.com. Repeat infringers will be blocked from accessing Talent Exchange. You understand that we own all photographs uploaded by you and we may copyright material containing such photographs. All right, title and interest in and to Talent Exchange, including without limitation all related information and technology, shall remain with PwC and/or its licensors, and you shall have no rights in or to the same. You acknowledge such ownership and intellectual property rights and will not take any action to jeopardize, limit or interfere in any manner with PwC ' or its licensors' ownership of or rights with respect to the same.
You will comply with all applicable domestic and foreign laws, rules and regulations in connection with your use of Talent Exchange.

To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, you agree to defend (at the indemnified party\'s option), indemnify and hold PwC and its respective partners, principals, employees, officers, directors, agents, affiliates, business associates, licensors, third party providers of service and subcontractors and insurers harmless from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs (including reasonable attorneys\' fees) and expenses in connection with any claim arising out of or in connection with any content or information posted or transmitted by you using Talent Exchange or that otherwise arise out of your use of Talent Exchange or that of any other third party who is given or gains access to Talent Exchange due to your action or inaction. At any time, PwC has the right to forego the indemnification and assume the defense of any claim. Notwithstanding the foregoing, it is not the intent of the parties to affect the rights of PwC\'s insurers to assume the defense or settlement of any claim against PwC for which insurance coverage is sought under any PwC policy.

Talent Exchange and all information provided to you hereunder are provided "as is", "as available", and to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, PwC and its respective officers, directors, partners, principals, personnel, affiliates, business associates, licensors, third party providers of services and subcontractors (collectively and inclusive of PwC, the "PwC Parties") disclaim all warranties with respect to the same, express, implied and statutory, including without limitations any implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, accuracy, completeness, non-infringement, non-interference, error-free service and uninterrupted service. This agreement is not an offer of any financial, tax, accounting, legal or other professional services or goods.

To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, the PwC Parties shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential or punitive damages, including without limitation damages for lost profits or revenues, goodwill, work stoppage, security breaches, viruses, computer failure or malfunction, use, data or other intangible losses or commercial damages, even if any such parties are advised of the possibility of such losses, arising under or in connection with this agreement, Talent Exchange, the use or inability to use the same, or any other subject matter hereof. In addition, to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, the PwC Parties shall not be liable for any loss or damage suffered by you which arises out of or in connection with any information or materials obtained or submitted by you via or in connection with Talent Exchange. To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, in no event will the aggregate liability of the PwC Parties under this agreement or in connection with its subject matter exceed five thousand U.S. Dollars ($5,000). Other PwC firms and their respective partners, principals, and employees, licensors and third party provider of services and subcontractors (collectively, the \"beneficiaries\") have no liability or obligations arising out of the agreement. You agree to bring any claim arising from the use of Talent Exchange against PwC and not against the beneficiaries. While PwC is entering into the agreement on its own behalf, this section is for the benefit of the beneficiaries and is relied on by each beneficiary. PwC accepts the benefits on their behalf.

To the extent Talent Exchange contains links to other websites and outside services and resources, we do not control the availability and content of those websites, services or resources, nor do we necessarily review or endorse materials available at or through such other websites. Viewing other websites or utilizing outside services and resources is done at your own risk and such websites or services may be governed by separate terms and conditions and privacy policies that you should review. PwC shall not be liable for any loss or damage caused or alleged to be caused by or in connection with use of or reliance on any such content, goods or services available on or through any such site or resource.

Either you or PwC may terminate this Agreement, with or without cause, at any time. All terms and conditions of this Agreement that are intended by their nature to survive termination of this Agreement shall survive termination and remain in full force, including but not limited to the terms and conditions concerning any disclaimers, intellectual property rights, duties of confidentiality, limitations of liability, duties of indemnification and provisions regarding resolution of differences. Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason, you must cease all use of Talent Exchange.

This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with applicable U.S. federal law and the laws of the State of New York, without regard to conflict-of-laws principles. Each party irrevocably consents to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the United States Federal and New York State courts located in and serving the City of New York in connection with any dispute or claim arising under this Agreement. Each party waives any right that it may have to assert that such forum is not convenient. Each party agrees not to demand a trial by jury in any action, proceeding or counterclaim arising out of or relating to Talent Exchange. The 1980 UN Convention on Contracts for International Sale of Goods will not apply to this Agreement.

In the event of any conflict between this Agreement and any procedures or requirements set out in Talent Exchange, the provisions of this Agreement will prevail. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, void or illegal, it will be severed from this Agreement and will not affect, impair or invalidate any other provision, and it will be replaced by a provision which comes closest to such severed provision in language and intent without being invalid, void or illegal.

PwC may amend this Agreement at any time by providing a copy of the amended terms and conditions to you in any format, including electronically via Talent Exchange, which you must then accept or reject. If you reject such amended terms and conditions, this Agreement shall terminate automatically. This Agreement may not be otherwise amended. You may not assign, transfer, or change any rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of PwC. PwC may assign this Agreement in whole or in part without your consent.

No right under this Agreement or breach hereof may be waived except in writing signed by the parties hereto. The failure of either party to require performance of any provision of this Agreement will not be construed as a waiver of such party's rights to insist on performance of such provision or any other hprovision at some other time.

is a first-of-its kind marketplace that connects independent talent with exciting opportunities at PwC.
